page.title: 02RIBCHESTER and it's Museum.
page.content: Situated on the{River Ribble }about halfway between Preston and Clitheroe. The only village actually on the bank of the river causing serious problems of flooding and erosion.Though publisised for it's{Museum of Roman {Antiquity,}there have been many interesting{Bronze Age}finds including several cremation burials in urns. The Roman fort of{Bremetennacum} covered 5 3/4 acres,with the Praetorium just about where the open space is,infront of the Museum (now National Trust).This houses many finds from excavations: masonry,sculptures, coins,pottery,inscriptions and a replica of the parade helmet found in 1796(original in British Museum). Burnt wheat grains, perfect but carbonised,testify to the fate of the fort after the legions left.
